byline.original: By SHUAIB ALMOSAWA and KAREEM FAHIM
byline.contributor: Shuaib Almosawa reported from Sana, Yemen, and Kareem Fahim from New York

lead_paragraph: At least 30 people were reported dead after a bombing by the Arab coalition that could add to calls for an international arms embargo on Saudi Arabia.

headline.print_headline: At Least 30 Dead in Airstrikes in Yemen
headline.main: Yemeni Civilians Killed by Airstrike on Market, Witnesses Say

snippet: At least 30 people were reported dead after a bombing by the Arab coalition that could add to calls for an international arms embargo on Saudi Arabia.
abstract: Airstrike by American-backed Arab forces kills 30 people in market north of Sana, Yemen; deadly bombing fuels increasing calls for arms embargo against Saudi Arabia, who leads coalition fighting for control of country with Houthi rebels in conflict which now invlolves Al Qaeda and Islamic State.
